intro: Brassica sinapistrum, commonly known as wild mustard, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant has alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruits are pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
